alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 5:57PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Pine, southeastern Carlton and west central Douglas Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 557 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Willow River, to near Brook Park, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Moose Lake and Bruno around 605 PM CDT. Barnum and Nemadji around 615 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Sandstone, Mahtowa, Holyoke, Askov, Carlton, Wrenshall and Thomson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Minnesota.
